title: Throat Pain
description: Throat pain (also called a sore throat) is discomfort, scratchiness, or pain in the throat — especially when swallowing. It may come from an infection, irritation, or injury.

sections.heading: Common Symptoms
sections.content:
Pain or burning in throat

Difficulty swallowing

Dryness or scratchiness

Red or swollen throat/tonsils

Hoarse voice

White patches (in infections)

Swollen neck glands

Fever, cough, or runny nose (in infections)

sections.heading: Common Causes
sections.content:
**Infections:**

Viral infections – cold, flu, COVID-19

Bacterial infection – strep throat, tonsillitis

Mononucleosis – with fatigue and swollen glands


**Irritants or Injuries:**

Allergies

Dry air or pollution

Smoking or vaping

Acid reflux (GERD)

Shouting, singing, or talking too much

sections.heading: Precautions
sections.content:
Avoid sharing utensils or drinks

Wash hands often

Use a mask if sick or near someone ill

Avoid smoking, spicy food, and very cold drinks

Stay hydrated

sections.heading: Home Remedies & First Aid
sections.content:
Gargle with warm salt water (1 tsp salt in 1 cup water)

Drink warm fluids (tea, soup, honey with water)

Suck on throat lozenges

Use steam inhalation or a humidifier

Take paracetamol or ibuprofen for pain and fever

sections.heading: When to See a Doctor
sections.content:
Throat pain lasts more than 3 days

High fever (over 101°F or 38.3°C)

Swelling in neck or tonsils

White or yellow patches in throat

Difficulty swallowing or breathing

Ear pain or rash

If exposed to strep throat or mono

sections.heading: Emergency Signs – Go to the ER If:
sections.content:
Severe swelling in throat or neck

Trouble breathing or swallowing

Drooling or inability to speak

Stiff neck + fever (may indicate serious infection)

Throat pain after choking or chemical exposure

sections.heading: Doctor’s Treatment
sections.content:
Antibiotics (eg, for strep throat)

Throat sprays or stronger pain relief

Tests (throat swab, CBC, etc.)

Referral to ENT if chronic or recurrent

sections.heading: What Not to Do
sections.content:
Don’t ignore throat pain with high fever

Don’t use leftover antibiotics

Don’t smoke or shout loudly when throat is sore

Don’t share personal items if contagious
